conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: extruded walls with thickness, visible interior volumes, and an angled/isometric-like viewpoint with ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; clean cutaway. Minor simplification of wall-top detailing and some corners/openings are generalized.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set and adjacency largely match (garage at right/bottom-right, bedroom cluster at right, master suite at top-right, main living core). Some exterior/covered patio areas and minor boundary nuances appear simplified or not fully represented; door/window locations and proportions are not consistently verifiable from the render.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and program elements are present (beds, living seating, dining, kitchen counters, bath fixtures, garage/car). Some rooms are sparsely furnished or simplified.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with good lighting and separation of floors/walls. Room-name text labels are present (UI/text contamination per rubric). Openings/windows are not strongly legible.

detected_errors.description: Some exterior/covered patio regions and certain plan boundary nuances appear simplified or partially missing compared to the 2D plan.
Doors/windows and opening proportions/placements are not consistently represented or clearly verifiable against the 2D plan.
Text labels (room names) are visible in the 3D render, reducing presentation score per rubric.

summary: A true, clean 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, but with some simplified/missing exterior areas and less-faithful/less-legible door-window detailing.
